intro: Rotheca pilosa, commonly known as the hairy rotheca, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Rotheca pilosa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
